Based on the user's preference cues and genre information, I would recommend two movies: "The Tempest" (1623) by William Shakespeare and "Interview with the Assassin" (2002) by Oliver Stone.
Both movies are in the same genre of war films. "The Tempest" tells the story of Prospero, Duke of Milan, who has been exiled for 40 years after a tragic event involving his brother. In this movie, Prospero and his daughter Miranda have come back to their island after being exiled by their own brother. They are comforted by their daughter Miranda and served by their spirit Ariel and their deformed slave Caliban. When Prospero raises a storm to wreck this perfidious brother and his confederates on the island, his long contemplated revenge at last seems within reach.
"Interview with the Assassin" is a 2002 American crime drama film directed by Oliver Stone. The film stars Brad Pitt, Edward Norton, Jason Patric, George Clooney, Kevin Spacey, and Uma Thurman as the lead role of "John Smith" who is suspected of committing a series of murders in New York City over a period of several years.
In this movie, John Smith (played by Brad Pitt) is an investigative journalist from Los Angeles. He is assigned to investigate the supposed serial murderer who is believed to have committed multiple murders in New York City over a period of several years.
